Package com.github.tommyettinger.ds.support.sort

Class FilteredComparators

java.lang.Object
com.github.tommyettinger.ds.support.sort.FilteredComparators
public class FilteredComparators extends Object
Produces Comparators that can sort Strings and Collections while filtering out chars/items that don't match a predicate, and/or altering chars/items when they are compared. Meant to be used with FilteredStringOrderedSet and FilteredStringOrderedMap.

    • makeStringComparator

      public static Comparator<String> makeStringComparator(CharComparator baseComparator, com.github.tommyettinger.function.CharPredicate filter, com.github.tommyettinger.function.CharToCharFunction editor)
      Like makeStringComparator(CharPredicate, CharToCharFunction), but takes a base comparator that compare char items in a non-ascending order if needed. Another option could be to call the other makeStringComparator() and reverse the Comparator it returns.
      Parameters:
      baseComparator - a CharComparator that will be used to compare individual chars, not Strings
      filter - a CharPredicate that should return true iff a character should be considered for equality/hashing
      editor - a CharToCharFunction that will take a char from a key String and return a potentially different char
      Returns:
      a Comparator for Strings that will respect the given filter, editor, and base comparator

    • makeComparator

      public static <T extends Comparable<T>, I extends Iterable<T>> Comparator<I> makeComparator(com.github.tommyettinger.function.ObjPredicate<T> filter, com.github.tommyettinger.function.ObjToSameFunction<T> editor)
      Creates a new Comparator that will respect a filter and an editor; it will be able to compare any Iterable of T with any other Iterable of T. The filter is an ObjPredicate of T items (not Iterable of T items!); the comparison of two Iterable of T will only consider T items for which the filter returns true. When two T items need to be compared for equality, they will each have the editor applied to that item during the comparison only; the editor is an ObjToSameFunction of T, so it takes a T item and returns a T item.
      This overload requires T to be Comparable to other T items, and does not need another Comparator.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of items in each Iterable; must be Comparable to other T items
      Parameters:
      filter - this will be called on each T item in consideration; only items where this returns true will be used
      editor - this will be called on each T item that needs to be compared and can return a different T item to actually compare
      Returns:
      a Comparator of Iterable of T, which will use the given filter and editor

    • makeComparator

      public static <T, I extends Iterable<T>> Comparator<I> makeComparator(@NonNull Comparator<T> baseComparator, com.github.tommyettinger.function.ObjPredicate<T> filter, com.github.tommyettinger.function.ObjToSameFunction<T> editor)
      Creates a new Comparator that will respect a filter and an editor; it will be able to compare any Iterable of T with any other Iterable of T. The filter is an ObjPredicate of T items (not Iterable of T items!); the comparison of two Iterable of T will only consider T items for which the filter returns true. When two T items need to be compared for equality, they will each have the editor applied to that item during the comparison only; the editor is an ObjToSameFunction of T, so it takes a T item and returns a T item.
      This overload allows specifying a baseComparator that can compare T items; this is needed when T is not Comparable or when the order needs to be non-standard even after items are filtered and edited (such as if you need reversed sort order, or need to sort based on an item or field in each T).
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of items in each Iterable
      Parameters:
      baseComparator - used to compare T items after the filter and editor have been applied
      filter - this will be called on each T item in consideration; only items where this returns true will be used
      editor - this will be called on each T item that needs to be compared and can return a different T item to actually compare
      Returns:
      a Comparator of Iterable of T, which will use the given filter and editor
